sagex.phoenix.util

Class PhoenixScriptEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • sagex.phoenix.util.PhoenixScriptEngine
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PhoenixManagedScriptEngine

    public class PhoenixScriptEngine
extends java.lang.Object
    Creates a scripting engine that is capable of executing scripts (ie, javascript, python, groovy, etc) while allowing access to Phoenix and the SageTV apis.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected javax.script.ScriptEngine engine

      PhoenixScriptEngine(java.lang.String scriptType)
      Creates a Phoenix Scripting Engine that gets an engine based on the specified named scripting engine, ie, "JavaScript", "Python", etc.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PhoenixScriptEngine

        public PhoenixScriptEngine(java.io.File file)
        Creates a Phoenix Scripting Engine that gets an engine based on the extension of the file. ie, a file.js would return a JavaScript engine; file.groovy would return a Groovy engine, etc. The contents of the file is NOT added to the script engine. You still need to call addScript() to add a script to the script engine.
        Parameters:
        file -

      • PhoenixScriptEngine

        public PhoenixScriptEngine(java.lang.String scriptType)
        Creates a Phoenix Scripting Engine that gets an engine based on the specified named scripting engine, ie, "JavaScript", "Python", etc.
        Parameters:
        scriptType -

      • PhoenixScriptEngine

        public PhoenixScriptEngine()

    • Method Detail

      • init

        protected void init(java.io.File file)
        Initializes the engine using a file (ie, the script type of the file). The contents of the file is NOT added to the ScriptEngine. This just initializes the engine type based on the file type
        Parameters:
        file -
